name: Founders Factory
slogan: A new corporate-backed, multi-sector, incubator and accelerator
description:
We're a new model in business creation with extraordinary ambition and breadth. Together with our blue chip corporate partners, we build and scale early stage technology companies across multiple sectors.  We invest capital and resources in building the next generation of breakout technology businesses at an unprecedented scale.  We will build and scale 200 early stage technology companies across multiple sectors in the next five years. 

We‚Äôre a magnet for the best talent in technology and have an undeniable reputation for creating successful businesses worth billions.  Our team has a history of being at the forefront of emerging technology trends putting us at the heart of the global tech community.  

And finally, we are born out of the Founders Forum; the top network of entrepreneurs and business leaders, giving us unparalleled access to corporate partners, audiences, and access to capital.

jobs.title: Account Manager - Asia Pacific (Healthy Health)
jobs.description:
HealthyHealth is looking to kick start its brand new Hong Kong Office with a Managing Director.

The role will have two primary short/medium term focus as well as one long term focus. In the short/medium term, the individual is required to manage a large scale project with an international client in Hong Kong and Korea, focusing on the delivery as well as the Client Relationship.

Secondly, the individual will be required to develop business across the Region. This will be both cross-selling into existing clients, as well as finding new ones. In the long term, the individual will be required to build his/her team to grow the office as our business in Asia-Pacific grows.

The Individual will work closely with the companies Chief Executive, based in London who will be present for the first months after the office opening.

Detail:
Account & Project management:
‚óè Manage client engagement on the ground - meetings, workshops, presentations
‚óè Own client projects and run project streams
‚óè Deepen relationships: cross-sell, up-sell, new products and geographies
‚óè Customer success
‚óè Client insights, learnings
‚óè Organisational mapping - key roles and decision-makers
‚óè Call reports
‚óè Servicing
‚óè Revenue tracking and reporting

Business Development:
‚óè Account planning, wallet sizing
‚óè Cross-sell, up-sell
‚óè New opportunities, find pain points
Long Term:
‚óè Source and hire relevant employees
‚óè Manage Asia-Pacific Team

Benefits:

‚óè HK$500,000 annual salary + Bonus
‚óè Work from a central HK Office
‚óè Market-Standard Benefits
‚óè Yearly Team Holiday
‚óè Equity incentive
‚óè Access to the Founders Factory network
‚óè 20 days vacation
‚óè Free coffee / Tea
‚óè Shower and bike locker in the office
‚óè Work with FTSE100 (and international equivalent) clients
‚óè Multicultural team

Must have‚Äôs:
‚óè 5+ years of experience in Project Management
‚óè 3+ years of Business Development experience
‚óè Visa-free travel to Seoul, Korea
‚óè Speaks Mandarin (& Cantonese)
‚óè Speaks English

Nice to have‚Äôs:
‚óè Visa-free travel to most Asia-Pacific countries
‚óè 2+ years of Management Experience
‚óè Speaks Korean

jobs.title: Associate Product Manager (TMIK)
jobs.description:
What your role will be
As an Associate Product Manager, you will be critical to guiding TMIK through one of the most exciting times - continuing to build their flagship app product and website. You will be part of a small, tight knit group of people with passion for what they do and lots of media experience (Vogue, Guardian, Founders Factory). The CEO, Emily Sheffield has twenty years of experience in the media, including former Deputy Editor and Digital Director of Vogue, columnist Evening Standard and Sky News.

What your mission will be
Mainstream media is not engaging millennials. There is a lack of innovation in delivery and an endless cycle of hyped negativity. This Much I Know is solving this problem by building an interactive global news community that helps drive positive change. And engages its community in campaigns around the big issues of the day.¬†The style of our delivery is digestible, immediate, dynamic and always interactive. We have live apps on Google Play and Apple Store, a growing newsletter, website, podcast and instagram community. We recently won a NESTA government grant for innovation. Your scope will be to help deliver these products inline with the mission, user needs, data, timelines and industry insight. You will be part of a fast-paced, fun, supportive environment with lots of opportunities to get involved in various strategic and operational initiatives.

www.thismuchiknow.news

üôå The role
Understand the users‚Äô needs, the company‚Äôs strategy, the business metrics and what is happening in the fast paced industry that is media

Communicate vision and direction to the development team and stakeholders throughout the project and create requirements inline with the desired timelines and impact

Supporting prioritisation of the product backlog in consultation with key stakeholders. 

Ensure working with the CEO and CTO that the team always has an adequate amount of prior prepared tasks to work on

Assess value, develop cases, and prioritise stories, epics and themes to ensure work focuses on those with maximum value that are aligned with product strategy

Provide backlog management, sprint/ iteration planning, and elaboration of the user stories.¬†

Obsess about impactful improvements to the users‚Äô experience and business metrics.

Embrace a "buck stops here" and honest attitude: be proactive in removing blockers and contribute in raising team performance and implement best practices

üéâ What we're looking for in someone
Huge passion for digital products and media.

Someone who thrives in working in a small but effective team

At least 1 year of product management experience in a fast paced Agile/Lean environment

Experience with creating and maintaining backlogs, writing user stories and sprint planning

Experience in delivering app and web user facing product or supporting delivery

Experience in working with cross functional development teams

Experience in User Acceptance Testing a plus

Understanding of Agile /Lean methodologies

Effective at creating and maintaining relationships 

Loves great problems. 

You know how to uncover the jobs users have and how to go about finding the right solution.

Articulates the voice of the user. 

The ‚Äúwhy‚Äù behind your product and strategy underpins all the work you do

üëè What we offer you
Three to five days a week normal working hours¬†
An opportunity to work with a hugely talented and experienced product leader (the Guardian, Sky News....) and within the Founders Factory Incubator team. 
¬£30,000 per annum pro rata
28 days paid holiday annually
Start date: ASAP¬†

jobs.title: Backend Software Engineer (MedShr)
jobs.description:
About us:

Launched from London in October 2015, MedShr is a health technology startup with over 500,000 members in 180+ countries. We‚Äôre a private, professional medical network working to enable doctors and members of the medical community to share knowledge and skills with peers around the world to improve healthcare and save lives through clinical case discussion.

In August 2015, MedShr joined Founders Forum as a rising star company and become part of the Founders Factory accelerator program (https://workable.com/nr?l=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.foundersfactory.co%2F) . MedShr has been featured on the BBC, Sky News, The Evening Standard, The Telegraph and Metro News. MedShr won Facebook Start's Social Good App of the Year Award 2016 (https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fdevelopers.facebook.com%2Fblog%2Fpost%2F2016%2F05%2F31%2Ffbstart-apps-of-the-year-program-updates%2F) and more recently a World Summit Award (https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.worldsummitawards.org%2Fwinner%2Fmedshr%2F) .


Job description:

The role will be to work as a member of the engineering team with responsibilities ranging from designing, implementing and maintaining our backend APIs and services, to deploying our application and components in cloud environments.


Key Responsibilities:
* Develop, test, and maintain high quality scalable code for our APIs aiming to scale our application to millions of users.
* Maintain and deploy our application and its components in cloud environments.

Requirements

* Self starter with an ability to work independently and as part of a team
* 3+ years of experience with SQL databases ‚Äì we use MySQL
* 3+ years of experience with PHP
* 3+ years of experience with Node.JS
* Experience with Redis
* Experience designing and writing scalable production REST APIs
* Experience with Docker
* Source control using git
* Experience working with a disciplined, software release, build, and deploy processes

Bonus points for experience in:

* Frontend development using ReactJS, SASS/SCSS
* Microservices architecture
* Kubernetes
* Kafka
* Elasticsearch
* Google Cloud Platform and GKE

Benefits

You will be based in our Central London office, working within our product and development team. Competitive salary and share options for the right candidate. Please contact careers@medshr.net for further information and to apply for a role at MedShr.

jobs.title: Brand Marketing Manager [Stix]
jobs.description:
If you are interested in applying for this role, please do not apply through Lever. Please email your resume to jamie@getstix.co.

Company Overview
Stix provides women the products, education, and community they need, starting with a better pregnancy and ovulation test. Founders Cynthia Plotch and Jamie Norwood created Stix because buying high quality products should be easy and delightful, no matter the result you‚Äôre looking for. Stix is over 99% accurate, fairly priced, and delivered in a discreet envelope. Designed by women, finally.

Role Overview
Want to join as¬†the first full time hire at a venture backed, quickly growing startup? We are looking for a dynamic and creative individual to lead the charge on brand marketing and drive strategy for a rapidly growing marketing budget. Moreover, we‚Äôre looking for someone who wants to build something great, get in at the ground floor, and develop a customer-obsessed culture. To be successful in this role you will need to both see the big picture and execute rapidly. We‚Äôre constantly jumping between daily tasks and long-term strategy.¬†

The Role
+ Run content calendar and campaign strategy
+ Own strategy, optimize, and manage execution of organic social, website, blog, email, partnerships, and influencer marketing.¬†
+ Develop and execute omnichannel marketing campaigns for product launches, holidays, and other key events
+ Generate reports for digital marketing KPIs

Who You Are
Do you have a knack for balancing the art and science of digital marketing? Are you inclusive, courageous, discerning, curious, and devoted to the customer? Then read on...
+ 4+ years of experience working in marketing at a consumer brand, especially for eCommerce and D2C companies
+ Excellent communication,¬† writing, and management skills
+ Ability to build and lead a digital marketing team
+ Eye for design and passion for digital and content marketing
+ Experience developing and executing multi-million dollar ad campaigns across channels+ Innovative and analytical mindset
+ Hands-on experience with SEO/SEM, Facebook & Instagram Ads, Google & Youtube Ads, Advertising, Customer Acquisition, Analytics and Reporting, Growth Hacking, Cost Measurement, Google Analytics.

The Details
This is a full-time, salaried role. During covid, this is a remote role. In a post-covid world (TBD when that is lol), this role is based in Philadelphia. We also spend a great deal of time in NYC so open to someone in New York as well.¬† We‚Äôre open to remote for the right person.

Compensation &¬† Benefits
Salary will vary based on experience + equity plan to be discussed. We offer three weeks PTO, flexible hours, and health benefits.

To Apply
Please email your resume and cover letter to jamie@getstix.co. We can‚Äôt wait to meet you!






If you are interested in applying for this role, please do not apply through Lever. Please email your resume to jamie@getstix.co.

jobs.title: CEO, Founders Factory (India, Bangalore)
jobs.description:
We power founders to go further, faster. Great startups set out to solve big problems. We‚Äôre here to give founders what they need to solve them faster.

We are looking for a CEO for our new hub in Bangalore, India. They will be tasked with building and managing a 30 person team of brilliant and diverse entrepreneurs and operators; working with C-Level executives at multinational corporates; and advising and supporting founders at every stage in their startups' lifecycle. The CEO will need to be able to inspire the best talent and entrepreneurs to work with them.

Founders Factory India will have 4 industry-leading corporate partners and create and grow nearly 140 startups over the next 5 years. For every partner we will build 2 startups from scratch and accelerate a further 5 each year. In scaling the team to operate these two completely bespoke programs there will be immense uncertainty and a set of uniquely diverse problems to solve. If you believe in empowering people to make an impact through entrepreneurship then it will be more than worth it. We are looking for someone who shares this vision and has the passion and expertise to achieve it.


Requirements
- Previous experience as a founder, operator and/or experience within a startup studio environment
- Previous experience hiring and retaining a world class team
- Ability to deal with uncertainty and multiple diverse problems
- Ability to work with LPs and C-level executives
- Strong network across India and the Bangalore startup ecosystem 





Our team supports the startups we invest in. Just like top athletes, entrepreneurs need brilliant coaches. We‚Äôre those experts, the difference is we‚Äôre not afraid to get stuck in too. In each field we have an expert on hand so that our startups can move faster and smarter. Creating something exponentially more valuable to them than just cash.¬†

That‚Äôs without mentioning our investors, who are some of the world's biggest businesses. A partnership between them and one of our startups could be the secret to their success. We‚Äôre here to make that happen.¬†
It matters to us that we‚Äôre powering a better future. For us, that means funding people free from any bias and supporting businesses that we‚Äôre proud to show anyone. If that‚Äôs something you‚Äôre passionate about too, then we‚Äôre off to a good start. Even better if the thought of working with a variety of startups with all of their uncertainties and challenges sounds like the place you could do your best work.

jobs.title: Coder, Engineer, Developer, Tech Lead. Whatever you want to call yourself ü§ñ
jobs.description:
TL;DR

üöÄYou have the chance to be on the ground level at an amazing start up before you see them being talked about on Tech Crunch 
‚öô As the first person to know the difference between OOP and FP (if there is oneüòà) you are in charge! 
üíØ The user is the most important person so unnecessary theoretical coding practices can stay in the texts books. 

About you
üí§ A talented dev in 2020 with your pick of safe reliable gigs at nice stable companies. This bores you!
‚è≤ Are too busy to read a long job description.
üòì Work you want to do is not happening at your current place.

The Startups
Our full portfolio can be found here: foundersfactory.com/london/portfolio/. 

What is most important and universal across all the companies is a healthy 'risk appetite'. 

Our proposition is very simple. For 6 months you will be challenged to do the best work you have ever done. At the end you will have two possibilities:

ü¶ÑBest case scenario: You have built a unicorn and have equity 

üôàWorst case scenario: You have an amazing story that will open doors for you for the rest of your career. 
 
Tech
- A love of code, all of it, front and back, this is a full stack dev role.
- Python, (Ruby are nice but not essential.  
- Javascript (any of the libraries ).  
- Modern thinker around testing and release practices. Waterfall is dead
- Hands on mentality.
- The ability to explain tech to non-techs.
- Know good devs that you would want to join forces with.

Benefits
- Autonomy, Freedom!
- Equity in the success that you built
- Working from home and flexible hours when you want
- Private medical plan
- Paul's Irish Bar in the office
- Catered lunches from Feedr every Thursday and Friday
- Mental health support programs from InsideOut 

What next?
Apply and I will message within 24 hours with an interview request if you are successful

jobs.title: Data Analyst (HealthyHealth)
jobs.description:
About us

We collect on average 600,000 data points including lifestyle, mental/emotional, social, pollution and others per customer annually and transform that into a risk assessment but also a preventative healthcare service.

‚Ä¢ Founded 2017
‚Ä¢ Seed
‚Ä¢ Raised ¬£1,000,000
‚Ä¢ 1-15 Employees
‚Ä¢ 0-5 Developers
‚Ä¢ Big data & analytics

Our distribution partners range from (re-)insurers, pensions, employers, public health institutions, pharmaceutical companies and others, making HealthyHealth a truly scalable business model.

UK Data Analyst

We are looking for a Data Analyst with 2+ years of experience to join our team on a full time basis. The data analyst will be responsible for establishing data collection, data processes and implementing data quality processes that allow us to deliver to clients across the world.

Together with the Data Science team, you will collaborate with the Head of Design, the Tech Lead and our remote engineering team based in Ukraine. From design and delivery, you will work as a cross-functional team to shape our products, fast paced growing company and international infrastructure, currently in Asia, America, and Europe.


A plus
- Equity incentive
- Central London (14 Dufferin Street, EC1Y 8PD -¬†¬†Barbican, Moorgate,¬†¬†Old Street stations)
- Access to the Founders Factory network
- 20 days vacation
- Free coffee / Tea
- Shower and bike locker in the office
- Work with FTSE100 clients
- Multicultural teamTasks
- Design, build, test and maintain backend code (API and data transformation layer)
- Take ownership of the codebase, suggest improvements, refactoring, etc.
- Collaborate with other team members (QA, designer, etc.) to find the best solution for our products
- Be an active member of scrum team


Skills
- Python, or any other backend programming language (you must be willing to learn Python in such case)
- Data Analytics: 2 years (Required)
- Bachelor‚Äôs degree (or higher) in any quantitative field
- Good test-driven development habits
- Version control (ideally Git)
- Data visualisation


Task
- Identify important and interesting questions and translate those questions into concrete analytical tasks.
- Bring new data to answer client questions ‚Äì collating and organising data from multiple sources
- Apply analytical techniques and tools to extract and present new insights to clients using reports and/or interactive dashboards
- Relay complex concepts and data into visualisations
- Collaborate with other team members (data scientists) to find the best solution for our products
- Design, build, test and maintain backend code (Establish data processes, define data quality criteria, Implement data quality processes)
- Take ownership of the codebase, suggest improvements, refactoring, etc.
- Be an active member of scrum team


A plus
- An understanding of insurance and/or health analytics
- Keen interest in AI and machine learning
- Ability to work in Agile environment


Benefits
- Equity incentive
- Access to the Founders Factory network
- 20 days vacation
- Free coffee / Tea
- Shower and bike locker in the office
- Work with FTSE100 clients
- Multicultural team
- Central London location in a vibrant area (14 Dufferin Street, EC1Y 8PD -¬†¬†Barbican, Moorgate,¬†¬†Old Street stations)
- Salary based on experience

jobs.title: Data Scientist (HealthyHealth)
jobs.description:
WHO WE ARE
We collect on average 600,000 data points annually per customer, to transform into a health risk assessment or healthcare prevention service. These data points include: activity, lifestyle, mental/emotional, social and pollution information.

‚Ä¢ Founded 2017
‚Ä¢ Seed
‚Ä¢ Raised ¬£1,600,000
‚Ä¢ Named one of Forbes‚Äô ‚Äú20 Tech-For-Social-Good Startups To Watch‚Äù
‚Ä¢ 1-15 Employees
‚Ä¢ Big data & analytics

Our distribution partners range from (re-)insurers, pensions providers, employers, public health institutions, pharmaceutical companies and others, making HealthyHealth a truly scalable business model.

THE POSITION
The purpose of this data science role is to define and implement with insurers, employers and other B2B clients, the best solutions, insights analysis and reports for digital underwriting.

The position requires a great deal of curiosity and business acumen in order to understand our B2B clients‚Äô areas of improvements. The overall aim is to leverage our strong assets such as our dataset unique to the market, along the models built on top and their related products, to contribute to the success of our B2B clients. Additionally, your mission with the rest of the data science team would be to contribute to design and implement the most insightful and engaging B2C solutions.

The data science team will coordinate with the rest of the HealthyHealth team to identify and deliver key insights and analysis about end-users. These insights will be used to define and continuously improve the end-user‚Äôs journey towards a healthier life.

THE REQUIREMENTS
* Solid data science skills
* Experience in coding in Python (essential) and R (preferable)
* An in-depth understanding of the actuarial techniques in Insurance and a solid business acumen to
develop new products
* Tableau capabilities to create reports and to value insights
* A highly motivated self-starter

A plus
An understanding of insurance and/or health analytics
Keen interest in AI and machine learning

Ability to work in Agile environment

BENEFITS
Equity incentive
Access to the Founders Factory network
20 days vacation
Free coffee / Tea
Shower and bike locker in the office
Work with FTSE100 clients
Multicultural team
Central London location in a vibrant area (14 Dufferin Street, EC1Y 8PD - Barbican, Moorgate, Old Street stations)
Salary based on experience

jobs.title: Digital Product Designer
jobs.description:
üëã Hey, We're Founders Factory

Founders Factory is improving the odds of startup success, empowering anyone to impact the world through entrepreneurship.

We‚Äôre changing the venture model, trusting our ability to make a real difference to the companies we invest in. Our platform gives entrepreneurs market access to multi-national corporates, and bespoke operational support from a big and brilliant team. This allows us to do things that don‚Äôt scale, tailoring a program to every startup that joins. Letting our startups tap into skills they need but can‚Äôt yet access.

All of this is funded by our corporate partners, but their role is not simply cash. They bring the best bits of their businesses to our startups - validation, distribution, insight and capital. These are ingredients that startups others don‚Äôt have, which is why you see startups here that can not exist anywhere else.¬†

We‚Äôre here so founders who see the future differently get the skills they need to make it a reality. We‚Äôre proud to back founders others wouldn‚Äôt and we back ourselves to make them successful. We know the biggest impact comes from those that don‚Äôt fit the mould so we‚Äôve made Founders Factory their home.

üëü Our Culture

Working with us is very different than other companies. It's not just a job ‚Äì instead, a pursuit that we live and breathe every single day. We are resilient business builders, incredibly passionate and thrive in uncertainty. We want to obtain a deeper understanding of the conditions that lead to successful innovation. We hope to show there is a better way to build tech startups and take on the issues of why most startups fail. We are creating something meaningful and get paid to learn at an incredible pace.


üí™ Your Responsibilities
- Taking ownership of the end to end design process, bringing to life the customer experience and the business vision/mission
- Having a human focused approach to building technology businesses, balancing the customer needs and the business requirements.
- Communicating your ideas and progress
- Prioritise learnings. Ask the right questions and seek feedback when needed.
- Spotting opportunities by taking a keen interest in the business landscape and relevant technologies.
- Managing your time and and driving momentum within the business by subscribing to lean methodologies. Research and testing will be embedded into your process. You will use tools and methods that help move forward quicker, faster and with confidence
- Be solution-focused - make sense of a problem space by proposing and trying solutions. You can think creatively and are resourceful.
- Ensuring there is a clear vision and purpose and we are embodying and communicating the values.
- Sometimes you might need to treat requirements as assumptions and validate them.
- You have an ability to deliver value


üéØ Required skills, competencies and experience
- Demonstrated ability operating in an ambiguous environment¬†
- At least three years of design experience in roles demonstrating leadership and ingenuity
- All the normal design tools


üëå We value
- Quick thinking and intuition, someone who can balance creativity with objective data
- A passion for creating products people love, caring about product performance is key
- The ability to operate in an ambiguous environment, adaptability is key
- Being comfortable with taking risks
- Wanting to continuously improve your skills and productivity, challenging yourself when you can
- Strong leadership that drives product
- Being approachable and optimistic 






üìà Benefits

We provide all the excitement and freedom of an early stage startup but with the stability and resources of a large organisation. This is your rare chance to contribute across the full business spectrum to become a founder in the future:

Growth: Work with and meet exceptional talent. Learn faster than you ever have before. Access our large network of investors and customers.
Autonomy: Freedom to execute, build businesses, not just products.
Support: marketing, legal, finance, fundraising, growth, business development and recruitment.
Health and Wellness: Comprehensive extended health care coverage from Vitality and Spill counselling.
Office Space: Desk space in fully-serviced office on High Street Ken with table tennis table, scooters and breakout spaces.
Office Meals: Catered lunches 2 days a week, unlimited breakfast, healthy snacks, freshly ground coffee and Paul‚Äôs Irish Bar.

We are committed to building a diverse culture and are eager to receive applications from all backgrounds. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination.

Please note: we have an overwhelming number of applications and will do our best to get back to you within 72 hours if you fit the bill.

jobs.title: Founder and CEO (Bomad)
jobs.description:
Founders Factory is unlike anywhere else. Within our incubator, we create entirely new products from scratch and turn promising concepts into prototypes and MVPs. We validate commercial assumptions along the way to attract a full founding team, then spin the new company out as a fully-fledged business.


What is Bomad?

Bomad unlocks wealth for the whole family, enabling parents to support their children to get on the property ladder, fund their education or buy a car.¬† Bomad will allow parents to visualise family wealth and income in one place and forecast retirement needs. 

Based on individual family requirements it will recommend a range of products to unlock illiquid assets such as property or pensions whilst protecting retirement funds.¬† It will then allow parents to securely and tax efficiently transfer wealth to their children when they need it most.


The Role

We‚Äôre looking for a Founder in Residence and CEO to lead Bomad, and the business that it becomes. As Founder in Residence, you will establish the overarching vision, develop the business model, the product functionality, go-to-market strategy and attract a world-class founding team around you.¬†After Bomad‚Äôs incubation period, you will become the CEO of the newly created business as it spins out of our incubator and joins our accelerator programme. You‚Äôll have ¬£250K funding as well as twelve months of operational support from Founders Factory.¬†


 You will be responsible for
- The ultimate success of Bomad and the resulting business, from build and launch through to scale
- Setting a clear mission and strategy, including product direction whether that's a consumer proposition or a B2B model
- Building B2B relationships with a network of Financial Advisors, Wealth Managers and Lenders
- Developing a direct to consumer brand¬†
- Hiring, motivating and retaining a world-class team
- Driving day-to-day operations and coaching functional teams


You will possess the following skills
- A proven track record of bringing ideas to life
- Experience working with new technologies and digital products
- Deep sector expertise of consumer financial services - specifically within wealth management, independent financial advice or consumer lending
- Startup experience, particularly FinTech
- Significant experience in a leadership capacity
- CeMAP qualified is desirable but not essential


You are
- Visionary: mission-driven and ambitious, with a clear vision and strategy
- A Thought Leader: charismatic, expert and at home on a stage; able to form views quickly in the face of new information and articulate them clearly and persuasively
- A Dealmaker: commercially-minded and able to conceptualise, design, negotiate and close brilliant deals with partners, customers and investors alike
- A Product Owner: customer-oriented and able to design, manage and market world-class products
- A Decision-maker: decisive in the face of limited information
- A Firefighter: calm in the face of unexpected challenges; quick to create, communicate and execute responses
- The Wearer of Many Hats: you do what it takes to get stuff done

jobs.title: Founder in Residence, CEO (Project Spencer)
jobs.description:
Founders Factory is unlike anywhere else. Within our incubator, we create entirely new products from scratch and turn promising concepts into prototypes and MVPs. We validate commercial assumptions along the way to attract a full founding team, then spin the new company out as a fully-fledged business.

üõí What is Project Spencer? 

Project Spencer is a homewares marketplace which allows brick and mortar stores to curate their inventory based on online sales trends and to uncover exciting new producers and brands from around the world. We are creating a marketplace which will connect independent brands directly with retailers, and eventually gather the data on emerging trends, which will even give us the power to create products.¬†

Independent retailers are thriving because they have the ability to deliver a personalised experience for customers who enjoy discovering new products and brands regularly. Our offering allows the brands to control what items they want to have available and allows retailers to make data driven decisions on what items and brands they want to stock.

üí∞The Role

We‚Äôre looking for a Founder in Residence, CEO to lead Project Spencer, and the business that it becomes. As Founder in Residence, you will establish the overarching vision, develop the marketplace, the product functionality, go-to-market strategy and attract a world-class founding team around you.¬†After Project Spencer‚Äôs incubation period, you will become the CEO of the newly created business as it spins out of our incubator and joins our accelerator programme. You‚Äôll have ¬£250K funding as well as twelve months of operational support from Founders Factory.¬†


You will be responsible for
- The ultimate success of Project Spencer and the resulting business, from build and launch through to scale
- Setting a clear mission and strategy, including product direction
- Building out our network of independent brands¬†
- Establishing client partnerships with retailers
- Hiring, motivating and retaining a world-class team
- Driving day-to-day operations and coaching functional teams


You will possess the following skills
- A proven track record of bringing ideas to life
- Experience working with new technologies and digital products
- Experience catalysing innovation and change
- Marketplace experience¬†
- Significant experience in a leadership capacity


You are
- Visionary: mission-driven and ambitious, with a clear vision and strategy
- A Thought Leader: charismatic, expert and at home on a stage; able to form views quickly in the face of new information and articulate them clearly and persuasively
- A Dealmaker: commercially-minded and able to conceptualise, design, negotiate and close brilliant deals with partners, customers and investors alike
- A Product Owner: customer-oriented and able to design, manage and market world-class products
- A Decision-maker: decisive in the face of limited information
- A Firefighter: calm in the face of unexpected challenges; quick to create, communicate and execute responses
- The Wearer of Many Hats: you do what it takes to get stuff done

jobs.title: Front End Developer - React
jobs.description:
Front End Developer - React

Founders Factory is unlike anywhere else. Our incubator is a fast-track for talented people to become Founders. We create entirely new products from scratch, leverage data, distribution and IP from our partners, then build founding teams that can spin out into a fully-fledged business.

We‚Äôre looking for talented engineers to join us as we are building a world class R&D center in Romania with the ambition to create a next-generation tech platform for early-stage start-ups. This platform will be pivotal in starting and growing 200 businesses over the next 5 years. 

We provide all the excitement and freedom of an early-stage startup but with the stability and resources of a large organization. This is a remarkable chance to grow your career, with options for contributing to an ambitious team and getting in on the ground-floor of the next high-growth startup! Come join our world class team of thinkers and creators.

What You Will Be Doing

You will be working closely with the R&D Center Manager to help build the Founders Factory tech platform which is designed to support all new Incubator companies in our London office.

You will be working and collaborating with the wider team in Bucharest and London consisting of design, concept and engineering.

The main focus will be on helping develop our platform but you will also have the opportunity to work ad-hoc with multiple incubation companies.

*Set the technical direction for our front-end technology, and then lead implementation
*Work closely with the development teams to ensure they understand and fit into the front-end technology approach
*Write high quality code and not be afraid to test it
*Peer review code to make sure we are all aligned
*Collaborate closely with design, concept and product teams.
*Identify and give ideas to help engineering productivity.
*Be involved with all meetings to share ideas and challenges on best practice.

Requirements

*Experience with React or Angular (React preferred)
*Experience with other Javascript Frameworks (Jasmine etc)
*Experience with HTML and CSS (Basic PHP knowledge is a plus)
*Experienced with front end patterns and best practice
*Version control with Git

Would be a plus

*A Computer Science degree from a reputable university
*Deep experience with web development
* Photoshop/Indesign skills
*Working with start-ups and collaborating with offshore teams
*Experience with at least one object oriented language :)

Benefits

*Competitive Base Salary
*Healthcare and pension scheme
*Company away days
*New shared working space
*New hardware and tech

This is an exciting opportunity to play a leading role in defining the way our businesses scale. Join Us!

(Founders Factory is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated ¬†to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce)

https://foundersfactory.co/

jobs.title: Head of Finance
jobs.description:
We're building the most powerful growth engine for African startups and their founders. 

Founders Factory Africa (FFA) is unlike any place else you‚Äôve ever worked. We are venture builders dedicated to solving some of Africa‚Äôs biggest challenges and capitalizing on it‚Äôs incredible potential by leveraging market and tech opportunities. Over the next five years, we‚Äôll build 40 businesses from scratch and scale 100 existing growth-stage ventures through our venture development programs. Backed by leading corporates, such as Standard Bank ‚Äì the continent‚Äôs largest bank ‚Äì we have access to their vast resources, infrastructure, and expertise and will bring those to bear for all our ventures and entrepreneurs. Starting with FinTech and HealthTech, FFA will expand our focus as we grow, adding other sectors that include  retail, transportation, energy, and education.

Our Culture
Our goals are audacious, and we want to work with people who share our passion for pursuing transformation at scale. We believe that good ideas can come from anywhere - not just the top - and we love to build our way out of uncertainty. At FFA, you will work with and meet outstanding and diverse talent from across the continent and help us build a collaborative, inclusive, and supportive network. You will work faster (and learn faster) than you ever have before.

With offices in Johannesburg and London, we are building an ambitious, talented, and passionate team, ensuring that Founders Factory Africa is the continent‚Äôs best partner for founders.





Responsibilities
- Overall responsibility for Founders Factory Africa finances and reporting.
- Prepare annual company budgets, monthly management account packs and year end accounts
- Lead on investor relations including financial reporting, board pack preparation, monthly investor calls and quarterly board finance committees
- Manage cash flow and banking including overseeing all payments and international transfers (eg SARB approvals).
- Responsibility for all taxes across Africa and the UK including Corporation Tax, VAT, Employee taxes, R&D tax and transfer pricing
- Manage relationship with third party advisors including bookkeepers, auditors and tax advisors
- Take responsibility for HR function including monthly payroll, pension scheme, employee benefits (including ESOP)¬†
- Company secretarial duties including all relevant filings with CIPC and Companies House
- Provide support & advice to portfolio businesses including accounting set up, banking advice, business planning, taxation and fundraising.
- Lead on portfolio tracking including fair value reporting and investment returns analysis
- Manage operating plan, including establishing OKRs and the tracking performance against them on a quarterly basis.
- Improvement and implementation of controls and processes across the business to improve operational and financial efficiency.
  


Requirements 
- Qualified chartered accountant
- Significant experience of leading a Finance function¬†
- Experience of financial control, forecasting and accounting ideally under both South African and UK standards
- Experience of corporate tax regimes (specifically corporation tax, VAT and transfer pricing) in South Africa and UK
- Willing and able to be hands-on, with a focus on doing the work rather than overseeing it.
- Ability and confidence to present complex information in a clear and concise way to our board directors and corporate investors
- Experience of working in a start-up environment (highly desirable).
- Experience of HR procedures would be an advantage
- Excellent interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to lead and work effectively in team situations¬†
- Successful track record operating in a hyper-growth environment
- Ambitious, entrepreneurial, pragmatic, commercial, highly analytical, clear communicator, comfortable with ambiguity.
  


Founders Factory Africa provides a rare opportunity to join a team of world-class thinkers, entrepreneurs, and creators. We provide the freedom and excitement of early-stage startups but the stability and resources of a large organisation. Founders Factory Africa has global ambitions, and you‚Äôll play a key role in our future success.¬†

This role is a once in a lifetime opportunity to join a high-growth organization as part of the founding team and to help shape the future of Africa‚Äôs startup ecosystem.

jobs.title: Head of Growth
jobs.description:
We‚Äôre searching for an entrepreneurial Head of Growth to Inform product concepts, commercial models and go-to-market strategies for the startups we create and drive early stage customer acquisition.



üëåResponsibilities 
- Drive early stage customer acquisition through tactical execution of organic and paid channels (including Search, Social, Display and Email)
- Identifying and understanding market segments, developing propositions, positioning and guiding verbal/visual identity and work with Product and Design teams to create and optimise customer experiences and conversion funnels 
- Work closely with our Brand Lead to iterate on audience hypotheses, propositions and creatives and collaborate with product teams to optimise user experiences and conversion funnels 
- Drive early stage customer acquisition, with strategic governance and tactical execution of organic and paid channels 
- Design and implement effective CRM and retention programmes across multiple touch points 
- Scope and implement best practice analytics for web and mobile products, gather and interpret qualitative and quantitative data to inform decisions 
- Work closely with founders participating in our accelerator programme - advising and supporting all facets of digital marketing and growth 


üëçRequirements
- 5+ years experience in digital/growth marketing 
- Experience in leading a team and hands-on experience with a range of tools and channels.
- Entrepreneurial, with an enthusiasm for early-stage startups.
- Excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with founders, investors and product teams. 
- Degree in business, marketing, economics or a related discipline.


üëèBenefits
- Share options in the Founders Factory New York portfolio 
- Private medical insurance and pension
- Flexible working 
- Shared maternity and paternity policies

jobs.title: Head of Growth (Guider)
jobs.description:
TLDR
Connect marketing with sales at an AI powered hyper growth tech startup focused on helping companies improve their culture.

The Company.
Guider is on a mission to give everyone access to the career and personal development they deserve. Our AI-powered mentoring and coaching platform connects the best mentors in organisations with those looking to learn and grow, creating an impactful culture of knowledge sharing and self-improvement. We're already working with some of the world's best known brands to help them develop their people, including Marks & Spencer, LVMH and Aviva. 

See this M&S case study video showing the impact we are having!

Guider also partners with companies who have a forward-thinking purpose. With this, Guider can tailor mentoring and coaching programmes to helping improve Diversity & Inclusion, Women in Leadership, High-Potentials and much more. 

If you're passionate about either self-development, mental health or diversity, then read on!¬†

The Role.
As the Head of Growth, you will be responsible for Guider‚Äôs bottom line by owning the intersection between sales and marketing. An ideal candidate is someone who has B2B marketing and growth experience, ideally in a SaaS scale-up. 

This role would be responsible for the development and management of B2B marketing activities at Guider. With a focus on acquiring new customers through various marketing channels, including (but not limited to): PPC, SEO/SEM, paid social, email, social, webinars, lead nurturing, and analytics. ¬†

Also we‚Äôre after a strategic leader who can balance big-picture thinking while being able to execute based on rapid experimentation. 

On the strategic side, you will be involved with providing revenue models, trends and new opportunities for growth. Reporting to the Founder.

The Responsibilities.
‚Ä¢ Plan and implement B2B digital marketing strategies across all channels
‚Ä¢ Establishing and managing all digital advertising¬†
‚Ä¢ Ownership of marketing lead generation
‚Ä¢ Ownership of marketing metrics: tracking and reporting learnings and growth to assist business development
‚Ä¢ Industry analysis to inform sales process and direct Guider‚Äôs positioning
‚Ä¢ Ownership of growth/revenue models - short term and beyond (12-24 months)
‚Ä¢ Researching and proposing additional opportunities for growth.

About you.
‚Ä¢ 5+ years in a B2B Growth or Marketing role
‚Ä¢ 3+ years in a scale-up/ Hyper-growth startup.
‚Ä¢ A track record of exceeding revenue goals and consistently hitting targets
‚Ä¢ An analytical mind and love of data
‚Ä¢ Ability to think strategically and commercially¬†
‚Ä¢ Experience establishing marketing channels from scratch
‚Ä¢ Entrepreneurial mindset with a hunger to hit goals, learn by doing, and own entire areas of marketing
‚Ä¢ Good understanding of Google Analytics and Google Ad Words 
‚Ä¢ Good understanding of a variety of SEO tools such as Moz, SEM Rush, Ahrefs
‚Ä¢ Exceptional organisational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects at once
‚Ä¢¬†Ability to work agile - being comfortable with continuously shifting priorities
‚Ä¢ A love of teamwork and collaboration

The Benefits of Working at Guider.
You will be part of a growing technology startup and help shape the future of self-development. 
Guider cares deeply about helping the technology industry become a more inclusive and diverse place and we work hard to lead by example.¬†

The Perks:
‚Ä¢¬†Free Food: Free Lunches on Thursdays and Fridays, via Feedr (Deliveroo for businesses).
‚Ä¢ Unlimited breakfast: Every day. Breakfast (cereal, yogurt) and healthy snacks, nuts, hummus and fruit.
‚Ä¢¬†Free drinks: Unlimited Beer and wine, Unlimited soft drinks, freshly ground coffee
‚Ä¢¬†25 Days Holidays
‚Ä¢ At the World‚Äôs Best Accelerator: We are a startup, amongst dozens of other startups.

jobs.title: Investment Manager
jobs.description:
We're building the most powerful growth engine for African startups and their founders. 

Founders Factory Africa (FFA) is unlike any place else you‚Äôve ever worked. We are venture builders dedicated to solving some of Africa‚Äôs biggest challenges and capitalizing on it‚Äôs incredible potential by leveraging market and tech opportunities. Over the next five years, we‚Äôll build 40 businesses from scratch and scale 100 existing growth-stage ventures through our venture development programs. Backed by leading corporates, such as Standard Bank ‚Äì the continent‚Äôs largest bank ‚Äì we have access to their vast resources, infrastructure, and expertise and will bring those to bear for all our ventures and entrepreneurs. Starting with FinTech and HealthTech, FFA will expand our focus as we grow, adding other sectors that include  retail, transportation, energy, and education.

Our Culture
Our goals are audacious, and we want to work with people who share our passion for pursuing transformation at scale. We believe that good ideas can come from anywhere - not just the top - and we love to build our way out of uncertainty. At FFA, you will work with and meet outstanding and diverse talent from across the continent and help us build a collaborative, inclusive, and supportive network. You will work faster (and learn faster) than you ever have before.

With offices in Johannesburg and London, we are building an ambitious, talented, and passionate team, ensuring that Founders Factory Africa is the continent‚Äôs best partner for founders.

The Role
We‚Äôre looking for an awesome Investment Manager to join our high-growth, venture development company. You‚Äôll have a passion for driving African start-ups to scale through strengthening their invest-ability and supporting with fundraising. You will have experience as an investment professional who can help articulate the commercial potential of portfolio companies by working with them to design and build an investment strategy to reach scale in Africa.

This is a fantastic role for a highly capable, experienced individual within a dynamic culture and environment. You will need to hit the ground running and rapidly take full ownership of investment readiness for our portfolio of start-ups. Your focus will be on working with our start-ups across the Venture Scaling and Venture Building arms of FFA, ensuring they receive the appropriate level of fundraising support, as well as growing and maintaining our relationships with the investor communities.



Responsibilities 
- Conduct an assessment of each start-up to establish their readiness status and capacity to raise external capital
- ¬†Liaise with start-up founders and other stakeholders within our portfolio to ensure they receive the appropriate level of investment support
- Manage financial model/cash-flow projections, structured investment strategy, pitch materials, data room, coaching for investor meetings and presentations in Africa and globally
- Ensure that each start-up‚Äôs investment plan is aligned with the broader FFA Build and Scale programmes and associated timelines 
- Develop and maintain relationships with investors through meetings, events and updates
- Help prepare for and organise FFA investor events, including our investment showcase days, with support from FFA events team
- ¬†Track and evaluate the overall performance of the FFA portfolio of companies
- Support in valuation assessment and deal negotiations with start-ups prior to Investment Committees
- Lead and encourage internal engagement to foster a diverse and inclusive culture


Requirements 
- Deep passion for tech and start-ups and a hunger to learn¬†
- Outstanding people skills, humility, hustle and resilience
- Minimum of 3 years of relevant work experience in private equity / venture capital / M&A or leveraged finance investment banking or equivalent role with deep understanding of financial modelling and pitch preparation has been developed
- ¬†Proven track record of synthesising insights and developing successful business strategies aligned with market trends¬†
- ¬†Highly organised individual, capable of managing parallel workstreams while maintaining an effective workflow and communication system 
  


Great-to-haves
- ¬†Experience in deal structuring and understanding of legal terms 
- ¬†Experience working with early-stage (pre-seed to Series A) start-ups in Africa is a bonus¬† 
- Relationship with a network of investors, VCs and angel investors in Africa is an advantage¬†
  





Founders Factory Africa provides a rare opportunity to join a team of world-class thinkers, entrepreneurs, and creators. We provide the freedom and excitement of early-stage startups but the stability and resources of a large organisation. Founders Factory Africa has global ambitions, and you‚Äôll play a key role in our future success.¬†

This role is a once in a lifetime opportunity to join a high-growth organization as part of the founding team and to help shape the future of Africa‚Äôs startup ecosystem.
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We're building the most powerful growth engine for African startups and their founders.

Founders Factory Africa (FFA) is unlike any place else you‚Äôve ever worked. We are venture builders dedicated to solving some of Africa‚Äôs biggest challenges and capitalizing on it‚Äôs incredible potential by leveraging market and tech opportunities. Over the next five years, we‚Äôll build 40 businesses from scratch and scale 100 existing growth-stage ventures through our venture development programs. Backed by leading corporates, such as Standard Bank ‚Äì the continent‚Äôs largest bank ‚Äì we have access to their vast resources, infrastructure, and expertise and will bring those to bear for all our ventures and entrepreneurs. Starting with FinTech and HealthTech, FFA will expand our focus as we grow, adding other sectors that include retail, transportation, energy, and education.

Our Culture
Our goals are audacious, and we want to work with people who share our passion for pursuing transformation at scale. We believe that good ideas can come from anywhere - not just the top - and we love to build our way out of uncertainty. At FFA, you will work with and meet outstanding and diverse talent from across the continent and help us build a collaborative, inclusive, and supportive network. You will work faster (and learn faster) than you ever have before.

With offices in Johannesburg and London, we are building an ambitious, talented, and passionate team, ensuring that Founders Factory Africa is the continent‚Äôs best partner for founders.

The Role
We‚Äôre looking for an awesome Investment Manager to join our high-growth, venture development company. You‚Äôll have a passion for driving African start-ups to scale through strengthening their invest-ability and supporting with fundraising. You will have experience as an investment professional who can help articulate the commercial potential of portfolio companies by working with them to design and build an investment strategy to reach scale in Africa.

This is a fantastic role for a highly capable, experienced individual within a dynamic culture and environment. You will need to hit the ground running and rapidly take full ownership of investment readiness for our portfolio of start-ups. Your focus will be on working with our start-ups across the Venture Scaling and Venture Building arms of FFA, ensuring they receive the appropriate level of fundraising support, as well as growing and maintaining our relationships with the investor communities.

Responsibilities

  • Conduct an assessment of each start-up to establish their readiness status and capacity to raise external capital
  • Liaise with start-up founders and other stakeholders within our portfolio to ensure they receive the appropriate level of investment support
  • Manage financial model/cash-flow projections, structured investment strategy, pitch materials, data room, coaching for investor meetings and presentations in Africa and globally
  • Ensure that each start-up‚Äôs investment plan is aligned with the broader FFA Build and Scale programmes and associated timelines
  • Develop and maintain relationships with investors through meetings, events and updates
  • Help prepare for and organise FFA investor events, including our investment showcase days, with support from FFA events team
  • Track and evaluate the overall performance of the FFA portfolio of companies
  • Support in valuation assessment and deal negotiations with start-ups prior to Investment Committees
  • Lead and encourage internal engagement to foster a diverse and inclusive culture

Requirements

  • Deep passion for tech and start-ups and a hunger to learn
  • Outstanding people skills, humility, hustle and resilience
  • Minimum of 3 years of relevant work experience in private equity / venture capital / M&A or leveraged finance investment banking or equivalent role with deep understanding of financial modelling and pitch preparation has been developed
  • Proven track record of synthesising insights and developing successful business strategies aligned with market trends
  • Highly organised individual, capable of managing parallel workstreams while maintaining an effective workflow and communication system

Great-to-haves

  • Experience in deal structuring and understanding of legal terms
  • Experience working with early-stage (pre-seed to Series A) start-ups in Africa is a bonus
  • Relationship with a network of investors, VCs and angel investors in Africa is an advantage

Founders Factory Africa provides a rare opportunity to join a team of world-class thinkers, entrepreneurs, and creators. We provide the freedom and excitement of early-stage startups but the stability and resources of a large organisation. Founders Factory Africa has global ambitions, and you‚Äôll play a key role in our future success.

This role is a once in a lifetime opportunity to join a high-growth organization as part of the founding team and to help shape the future of Africa‚Äôs startup ecosystem.

jobs.title: Lead/Senior Python Web Developer
jobs.description:
Lead/Senior Python Web Developer

Founders Factory is unlike anywhere else. Our incubator is a fast-track for talented people to become Founders. We create entirely new products from scratch, leverage data, distribution and IP from our partners, then build founding teams that can spin out into a fully-fledged business.

We‚Äôre looking for talented engineers to join us as we are building a world class R&D center in Romania with the ambition to create a next-generation tech platform for early-stage start-ups. This platform will be pivotal in starting and growing 200 businesses over the next 5 years. 

We provide all the excitement and freedom of an early-stage startup but with the stability and resources of a large organization. This is a remarkable chance to grow your career, with options for contributing to an ambitious team and getting in on the ground-floor of the next high-growth startup! Come join our world class team of thinkers and creators!

What You Will Be Doing

You will be working closely with the R&D Center Manager to help build the Founders Factory tech platform which is designed to support all new Incubator companies in our London office.

You will be working and collaborating with the wider team in Bucharest and London consisting of design, concept and engineering.

The main focus will be on helping develop our platform but you will also have the opportunity to work ad-hoc with multiple incubation companies from our portfolio.

Ideally you will be a senior software engineer with a strong interest in developing backend services in Python and looking to start a fresh challenge in 2019.

*Set the technical direction for our Back End technology, and then lead implementation

*Work closely with the development teams to ensure they understand and fit into the Back end technology approach

*Bring features all the way through the Design, Beta, Generally Available, Maintain cycle.

*Assist in the design and implementation of major features within our tech Platform.

*Write high quality code and not be afraid to test it

*Peer review code to make sure we are all aligned

*Collaborate closely with design, concept and product teams.

*Identify and give ideas to help engineering productivity.

*Be involved with all meetings to share ideas and challenges on best practice.

Candidate Requirements

* +3-5 years web development experience with Python and Django

* You are a strong programmer and know how to write quality code

* Experience with SQL or non relational database

* Experience with Amazon Cloud

* Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related disciplines.

* Curious and love problem solving

* Ability to communicate in English

Would be a plus

*A Computer Science degree or Engineering degree from a reputable university

* Exposure to other programming ecosystems & frameworks (Node.JS, React, mobile development)

* REST API's and software algorithms experience.

* Working with start-ups and collaborating with offshore teams

Benefits

*Competitive Base Salary
*Healthcare and pension scheme
*Company away days
*New shared working space
*New hardware and tech
*Access to Founders Factory benefits platform and network

This is an exciting opportunity to play a leading role in defining the way our businesses scale. Join Us!

(Founders Factory is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated ¬†to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce)
https://foundersfactory.co/

jobs.title: Linguistics & Curriculum Design Internship Arabic/French (Chatterbox)
jobs.description:
Chatterbox‚Äôs AI-powered work platform matches marginalised people in need of work with opportunities in the digital economy.¬†

We have developed an online language learning service for professionals powered by refugees. We uniquely combine AI powered self-study courses with regular practice alongside algorithmically matched native language coaches from the refugee community.

We‚Äôre looking for an exceptionally talented intern who wants to gain experience working in a fast-paced start-up environment whilst making the world a better place. Sound like you?¬†

Your profile¬†
‚Ä¢ You love languages and you‚Äôre studying for a degree in languages or linguistics.
‚Ä¢ You‚Äôre an Arabic or French native speaker
‚Ä¢ You‚Äôre rigorous, organised and you have a keen eye for detail.

The role
‚Ä¢ You will improve our French curriculum by checking the language, grammar and flow.
‚Ä¢You will give feedback to our Language Leads to create the best learning experience.¬†
‚Ä¢You will have the opportunity to help with tech, learning experience design and content creation, according to your interests.

Join our team and build something that matters
‚Ä¢Gain real-life experience working remotely with an international tech start-up with a strong social mission.
‚Ä¢Support us in plugging the language skills shortage whilst offering refugees the opportunity to rebuild their professional lives.¬†
‚Ä¢Help us deliver top-quality learning experiences to corporate clients such as BNP Paribas and McKinsey.

jobs.title: Marketing Manager (TYME)
jobs.description:
TL;DR create video/graphic content then publish across social media. Plant based food tech startup

Why you want to join and stay with Tyme
The creative process of making video and graphic content should excite the inner designer and videographer in you. This is your key responsibility!

You will own our social media presence. Currently Facebook and Instagram but also when we move to YouTube, Twitter,LinkedIn and TikTok

You will cultivate our following over email. This will be direct support for current customers and publishing campaigns.

Our customers love the taste of TYME but also believe in the mission and ethics behind it. How will you harness that energy into an ambassador program?

The package and benefits are:
‚Ä¢ 30k base salary
‚Ä¢ Mentorship directly from the founders¬†
‚Ä¢ Autonomy to build something new
‚Ä¢ Work within a HQ of 40+ other startups

Who are TYME?
We are a food tech startup that believe being busy doesn‚Äôt mean you should compromise on taste, convenience and ethics.

We were the talk of New York and got amazing reviews and traction. We have decided to move back to London and share our message.

The team is a mix of financial, culinary and marketing founders who met across a kitchen table to right the wrongs of the world over a good meal. TYME is our attempt to help a little bit.

To date we have attracted initial investment and been accepted onto the Founders Factory startup program. With you on board we can turn our small steps into big leaps.

Want to know more?
Apply! Please share what work you are proud of along with your CV. Bonus points if you start following us.¬†

jobs.title: Operations Intern (Meander)
jobs.description:
üåç What is Meander?¬†
Our mission is to make sustainable, thoughtful travel mainstream. We provide sustainable holiday experiences that take travelers off the beaten track, via trains, boats and more - but more than that, we want to create a movement that helps the world travel thoughtfully and sustainably once it can travel again.¬†

üå≥What are we looking for?¬†
We are looking for an ambitious and entrepreneurial individual to join us to support many different areas of our business operations for six months. This is a unique chance to work with a dynamic team and dig into what it really takes to build a business from its early days, and report directly to our founder and CEO. We‚Äôll need someone who isn‚Äôt afraid to jump right in and support us wherever needed: a fast learner with a proactive growth mindset who will thrive in an environment of changing priorities and high momentum.
This is a junior role with a lot of opportunity for growth and mentorship, working alongside trailblazers in the startup community. It is ideal for a recent graduate or someone with a couple years of experience who is looking for a challenge to kick start an entrepreneurial career.


üöâWhat are the key responsibilities? 
- Assembling travel journeys for customers using the tools and templates we already have in place, conducting your own research to add to and augment our templates, and making suggestions for further automation
- Updating and organising customer data to prioritise, action and streamline our processes
- Assisting with customer service, both online and via the phone
- Supporting the team in any area of the business needed, from marketing and community building, to product and data management¬†


‚õ∞ What are we looking for?
- Belief in our mission and a passion for sustainability and/or slow travel¬†
- The ability to write beautifully creative and grammatically perfect travel content
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and a positive and professional approach to interactions with our team and customers
- Proficiency in Excel and comfort working with and organising data sets
- An enthusiastic ‚Äòcan-do‚Äô attitude
- An ability to roll with the punches and switch gears¬†
- Bonus: operations experience in either in a high growth startup or small team¬†


üåû Benefits
- Work with an all-star, dynamic team in a rapidly growing, ambitious startup
- Get mentorship from across our team - we have some of the most brilliant minds in this space working on Meander
- Make your mark on the business with confidence - we‚Äôre a small team, and everyone's opinion matters
- Get exposure to all aspects of the business - we discuss and strategise together and look for ideas to improve from all quarters¬†

jobs.title: Product Designer
jobs.description:
As our Product Designer, you will be responsible for the success of our portfolio of businesses. You will lead the design of our products and provide structure and process as the business grows. You will focus on usability and experience, build out the MVP and refine brand.  


üëåResponsibilities
- Taking ownership and leading the UI and UX design, bringing to life the customer experience and the business vision/mission
- Ensuring there is a clear vision and purpose and we are embodying and communicating the values of the startup with effective solutions to solve business and customer pain points 
- Create the best version of the product with the time/resources and iterate on designs to help ensure we‚Äôre solving problems, using the best solutions 
- Working closely with the founding team, communicating your ideas and progress to relevant stakeholders. Always prioritise learnings. 
- Ask the right questions and seek feedback, you might need to treat requirements as assumptions and validate them. You have an ability to deliver value to the customer and business 
- Working closely with engineers to build out MVP and maintain consistencies across brand and product 
- Work closely with growth leads on marketing solutions to help scale audience and generate interest and customers where needed
- Help create a culture of design entrepreneurs, valuing a human centred approach that integrates the needs of the customers and the business
- Articulate how the product meets the user's needs by communicating their imagination in words. A true designer has a narrative, and tells the story with authority
  


üëçRequirements
- A passion for creating products people love, caring about product performance is key
- At least five years of design experience in roles demonstrating leadership and ingenuity
- Having a human focused approach to building technology businesses, balancing the customer needs and business requirements 
- Research and testing will be embedded into your process. You will use tools and methods that help move forward quicker, faster and with confidence 
- Prior experience in juggling multiple projects and delegating work effectively, iteratively implementing operational improvements to the way you and your team works 
- Demonstrated ability operating in an ambiguous environment - adaptability is key 
- Be solution-focused - make sense of a problem space by proposing and trying solutions 
- You can think creatively and are resourceful. Experience of all the normal design tools
- Quick thinking and intuition, someone who can balance creativity with objective data 
- Managing your time and and driving momentum within the business by subscribing to lean methodologies 
- Quick thinking and intuition, someone who can balance creativity with objective data 


üëèBenefits
- Share options in the Founders Factory New York portfolio
- Private medical insurance and pension
- Flexible working
- Shared maternity and paternity policies

jobs.title: SDR (Sales Development Rep) - Poplar
jobs.description:
Poplar is on a mission to democratise the creation of augmented reality content. Through our community of 1400+ AR creators, our platform has enabled the production of amazing augmented reality experiences for major brands including Universal Music, Sony Music, Fox, Disney, L‚ÄôOr√©al, King, and Speedo amongst many others.

We‚Äôre looking for a Sales Development Representative (SDR) to join our growing team based in London. You will work closely with the Business Development team to uncover new opportunities. You‚Äôre providing quality, actionable information to Business Development in order to bring in new business.

As this is a junior role, you will receive mentorship and support from the team in learning about the AR industry, the advertising sector, how to effectively find clients and convert opportunities into revenue. This will give you amazing exposure to the wider business - also one of the benefits of being at a startup! This stepping stone position is great for anyone looking to work in the fast-paced world of a pioneering digital technology company.

This is a great opportunity to join a small but ambitious team in a fast-moving industry with an experienced founding team, strong backing (Fuel Ventures, Founders Factory, Haatch Ventures, Ascension Ventures, Super Ventures) and an array of exciting clients.

Salary: ¬£25,000 - ¬£30,000 depending on experience, equity

In your first month..

We are in a new, exciting technical space so your focus will be on learning as much as you can about Augmented reality, here is a good place to start: our Blog.

We have built great relationships in the market before and kept things documented on Hubspot. How quickly can you catch?

You will also begin your first outreach activities, Lilit Mesyan will be your mentor and be on hand to guide you.¬†¬†

We will test your ability to perform some of the tasks in interviews, but feel free to state your case and show evidence in your initial application.¬†

What We Offer
‚Ä¢ Flexible working hours - we care about getting the job done more than the exact hours you‚Äôre at your desk.
‚Ä¢ Equity - we believe employees should share in the success of the business.
‚Ä¢ Fun and supportive culture - we firmly believe in fostering a positive work environment, which means having fun as a team while challenging ourselves. 
‚Ä¢ Support for community projects - we believe volunteering and community activities shouldn‚Äôt come out of your 25 days‚Äô holiday allowance. For example, our CEO is a Trustee of Save the Children UK and our CTO runs his own music charity.
‚Ä¢Inspiring surroundings - our office is filled with green life, but we also take the time to run offsites elsewhere in London (and beyond).
‚Ä¢ Opportunity to learn rapidly - you‚Äôll be working with experienced media tech pioneers in a fast-paced company and industry.
‚Ä¢Dog-friendly environment - just ask our office dogs, Indiya and Flip.

‚Ä¢ Support for community projects - we believe volunteering and community activities shouldn‚Äôt come out of your 25 days‚Äô holiday allowance. For example, our CEO is a Trustee of Save the Children UK and our CTO runs his own music charity.
‚Ä¢Inspiring surroundings - our office is filled with green life, but we also take the time to run offsites elsewhere in London (and beyond).
‚Ä¢ Opportunity to learn rapidly - you‚Äôll be working with experienced media tech pioneers in a fast-paced company and industry.
‚Ä¢Dog-friendly environment - just ask our office dogs, Indiya and Flip.

jobs.title: Startup CTO - AI/FinTech (Wise)
jobs.description:
Founders Factory is unlike anywhere else. As a start-up studio and accelerator, we provide the support and tools necessary to empower founders and businesses to go further, faster.

What is Project Wise? 

Wise is a FinTech business and one of the newest projects to join our portfolio. With a vision built around a future where banks become traders of data, they are currently building a product that uses voice analytics and NLP to extract business-critical insights from voice communications. Led by a Morgan Stanley alumnus with a decade of experience in investment banking, the business has a solid and experienced team with great ambitions. 

Role Description

As the first hire to join the CEO, you will be responsible for building our entire AI project platform from the ground up.¬† You will be our most senior technical decision maker - responsible for driving the infrastructural development of the business. You‚Äôll collaborate directly with the CEO on product development, technical strategy, and lay the groundwork for the technology as it scales.  You'll need to be someone who is willing to be completely hands-on during the product build, but also ready to lead a technical team in the future. 


Responsibilities 
- Build our data platform from scratch - take charge of platform development, and make key decisions on technical architecture
- Oversight of all aspects of engineering including technical strategy, best practice implementation, and technology stacks¬†
- Define technical support processes and ensure customer support for technical issues¬†
- Deliver the MVP, enabling us to test, iterate and serve our early customers
- Ensure the systems architecture and infrastructure is scalable and can support a large B2B platform¬†
- As the company grows, you will eventually lead a team of engineers and react to changing commercial and partner requirements


Technical Requirements 
- Strong NLP and Speech Recognition understanding 
- Exceptional experience building a machine learning product, ideally for financial institutions¬†
- Minimum of 7 years of industry experience OR have built at least 2 - 3 products
- A track record of delivering well-engineered products that delight users


What we want from you
- Able to deal with and keep motivated in uncertainty
- Have a great passion for creative problem solving: able to take a step back and practice ‚Äúfirst principles thinking‚Äù when necessary
- Relentlessly resourceful in the face of potential limitations
- Have exceptionally high standards in everything you do, big and small
- Thrive in environments where you are given lots of responsibility and freedom
- Able to put results before ego and to take criticism constructively


Benefits
- A competitive salary + equity package that rewards you for joining us from the start of our journey¬†
- Work with 100+ start-ups in one space at the Founders Factory HQ¬†
- Catered lunches on Thursday and Friday, with wider network and knowledge sharing¬†
- Unlimited breakfast, healthy snacks and variety of coffee and beverages¬†

jobs.title: Startup Studio Head of Engineering
jobs.description:
We‚Äôre searching for an entrepreneurial¬†Head of Engineering¬†to support the technical side of Founders Factory portfolio businesses. The strength of our engineering team is core to building our tech startups from scratch from our studio. In this role you will be both a technical and people leader. You will be responsible for supporting engineers to do their best work and empowering them to succeed at taking on the challenges at the heart of the tech startups we build together.

This role will suit you if you are you an experienced engineering manager but want to go beyond individual projects and have an impact on many teams and startups. 



üëåResponsibilities
- Knowledge of engineering practices and what defines good quality code
- Learning new technologies and approaches to building good software
- Apply your own diverse software development skills, knowledge & experience across a range of sectors, business models, & products
- Work closely with your fellow leadership team (including Product, Design, Data Science, & Talent) to identify risks and opportunities around team & strategy for our startups
- Be accountable for supporting hiring of potential technical cofounders for our portfolio startups
- Support the tech leads of our startup teams to help set their product & technical strategy
- Ensure learnings from each team & project are brought together to feed back into consistent best practices and processes for the new startups we‚Äôre building
- Provide technical & career mentorship for the members of the tech team
- Help shape the strategic direction of the Founders Factory incubation model
  


üëçRequirements
- Have engineering management experience in a high-growth startup or medium-sized product-focused tech company
- Demonstrated track-record of delivering well-engineered products with modern technologies for a variety of different problem domains
- Passionate about building businesses and the idea of helping form many new tech startups & teams every year
- Genuinely enjoy mentoring and coaching engineers to guide their professional, technical and personal development as well as motivating and challenging them to focus on delivering high-quality solutions that match the business requirements of a startup
- Enthusiastic about defining and cultivating a product-oriented engineering culture that instils a spirit of continuous improvement in all aspects of building products, while fostering multi-disciplinary teams that value inclusive and respectful collaboration
- Well organised, able to manage time effectively, and comfortable working across multiple projects/businesses concurrently
- Worked on a diverse set of full stack technologies including experience with web, mobile, data and infrastructure
- Skilled in a variety of programming languages, e.g. Javascript, Python, Java, or Swift
- Knowledgeable of a range of modern web or mobile frameworks, e.g. React, Angular, Django, Rails, iOS, or Android.


üëèBenefits
- Share options in the Founders Factory New York portfolio
- Private medical insurance and pension
- Flexible working
- Shared maternity and paternity policies
